name: MS-DOS 2.0 to 3.2x Backup Control File
summary: Learn about .@@@ files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: MS-DOS 2.0 to 3.2x created backup disks that contained a copy of each backed-up file and a BACKUPID.@@@ file. The file identified the disk as an MS-DOS backup disk.

FreeDOS, an open-source operating system that emulates MS-DOS on modern PCs and mobile devices, can also create backups that contain BACKUPID.@@@ files. To do so, use the FreeDOS /v (version) switch to choose the 3.2x and earlier backup format.

description: A file with a .@@@ extension is a backup control file created by the BACKUP program included with MS-DOS and FreeDOS. It contains data used to load a DOS backup, including the backup disk's sequence number and the date on which the backup was created.

instructions: You can use FreeDOS's RESTORE program to restore an MS-DOS backup disk that contains a @@@ file.
